newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Ford could move van assembly out of Belgium - paper.
newsitem.headline: Ford could move van assembly out of Belgium - paper.

text.p: U.S. car maker Ford might move assembly of its Transit vans from the Belgian town of Genk to Southampton in England, Belgian daily De Standaard said on Saturday, quoting Belgian BBTK socialist union sources.
The paper said the union had a Ford document that led it to the conclusion that assembly could be moved to England within the next few years to concentrate the activity in one plant.
Ford Genk currently employs some 2,500 people.
The report comes at a time when Belgian politics and unions are up in arms against a unilateral decision by French car maker Renault to close its Belgian assembly plant by July.
The closure will cost 3,100 Renault workers and some 1,000 workers at suppliers and subcontractors their jobs.
